contentheadline.headline: New York College of Podiatric Medicine

contentrichtext.text: {{no ref|date=June 2013}} [[File:WTM3 The Fixers 0050.jpg|thumb]] The '''New York College of Podiatric Medicine (NYCPM)''' is a private specialized college located at 53 East 124th Street, [[Harlem]], in [[New York City]]. Founded in 1911, NYCPM was the first Podiatric Medical school established in the United States. NYCPM was founded by Dr. Maurice J. Lewi, a physician who decided a field of medicine should be dedicated entirely to the feet. To date, NYCPM has graduated 25% of the nation's licensed podiatric physicians.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} A minimum of 90 credit hours of undergraduate studies is a prerequisite for admission. New York College of Podiatric Medicine is the oldest and largest [[podiatric medical school]] in the U.S.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} The Foot Clinics of New York, its associated training center, sees over 56,000 patient visits a year, making it the largest foot clinic in the world. {{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} The President of the College is Louis L. Levine. == External links == * {{official|http://www.nycpm.edu}} *{{twitter|nycpm1}} {{coord|40.8049|-73.9404|type:edu_globe:earth_region:US-NY|display=title}} {{NYC Colleges}} [[Category:Universities and colleges in New York City]] [[Category:Podiatric medical schools in the United States]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in Manhattan]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1911]] {{US-northeast-university-stub}}
